meanings.definition: Causing one to remember or think of something
meanings.sent1: The old photograph was remindful of happy times.
meanings.sent2: She felt remindful of her childhood when she visited the park.
meanings.sent3: The smell of freshly baked cookies was remindful of grandma's house.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the ocean was remindful of a peaceful lullaby.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the full moon was remindful of a silver coin in the sky.

meanings.sent1: He was remindful of the dangers lurking in the dark forest.
meanings.sent2: She remained remindful of her surroundings while walking alone at night.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed remindful of the mouse hiding behind the couch.
meanings.sent4: The detective was remindful of every detail at the crime scene.
meanings.sent5: The teacher was remindful of the students' progress throughout the semester.
